cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: near the extreme southwest Florida peninsula, about 55 miles SE of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the eastern and then north-central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the southeast Louisiana to Mississippi coast, near the Mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ochlockonee River to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL Panhandle (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward across Mississippi, Alabama, and the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph with higher gusts) are possible at New Orleans by Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge of 2–4 ft above ground level along the southeast Louisiana coast, including areas near New Orleans and Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall totals of 2–6 inches with localized higher amounts, leading to flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands
